title: Design Underground Decline Access
description: A mining engineer designs the main decline (a spiral tunnel) that will serve as the primary access for trucks and equipment into a new underground mine.

tasks.description: Define the starting point of the decline on the surface (the portal) and the target endpoint deep in the orebody.
tasks.expected_outcome: The start and end points of the decline are set.

tasks.description: Use a design tool to automatically generate an optimal decline alignment between the two points, respecting constraints like maximum gradient and minimum turning radius.
tasks.expected_outcome: An optimized 3D alignment for the decline is generated.

tasks.description: Finalize the design, including the dimensions of the tunnel and the locations for passing bays and service cutouts.
tasks.expected_outcome: A complete, practical design for the main access decline is created.
